text:
• t August 9, 19S5
OFFERING NAEB RADIO NETWORK OFFERING
Series 56-2 (Winter *56)
Title: NICHOLAS NICKLEBI
Type: Drama (Serial)
Time: 30 minutes
No*: 12 episodes
Origin: BBC
Audience: Gene ral
Release: Issue #1, 1956 (Jan, 1)
A radio adaptation by Charles Lefeaux of Charles Dickens* novel "Nicholas
Nickleby." The cast includes Gordon Davies, Cecil Trouncer, and Daphne Grey,
The tape recordings should be returned to, or traded with, the NAEB Radio Net¬
work (NOT BBC).
Date of expiry: Januaiy 31, 1956
* * * * * # * * * * * * -x- * * * * * * -x- -x- « * * -x- * * -x- -x- -x- * * * -x- * * * * * * * *
Series 56-3 (Winter *56)
Title: WESTWARD HO*
Type: Drama (Serial)
Time: 30 minutes
No.: 6 episodes
Origin: BBC
Audience: Gene ral
Release: Issue #1 (Jan. 1)
This is Charles Kingsley*s exciting tale of adventure in the days of the first
Queen Elizabeth, dramatized for broadcasting by Ronald Gow.
The tape recordings should be returned to, or traded with, the NAEB Radio Net¬
work (NOT BBC).
Date of expiry: March 16, 1956.
* * * * * -x- * -x- -x- * -x- * -x- -x- -x- *x- -x- -* * -x- * * -x- -x- -x- -x- -x- -x- * -x- -x- -x- -x- -x- * -x- -x- -x- -x- -x- * -x-
Series 56-U (Winter *56)
Title: RODNEY STONE
Type: Drama (Serial)
Time: 30 minutes
No.: 7 episodes
Origin: BBC
Audience: General
Release: Issue #7 (Feb. 12)
David Peel as Rodney Stone in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle*s exciting and romantic
novel of Regency days, dramatized in seven episodes by David Stringer.
This serial will be distributed immediately after WESTWARD HO* (see above), and
the two together make up a unit of 13 programs. It is further suggested that these
two series be programmed following the end of the serial THE BRIDE OF LAMMERMOOR
(55-38) to make a series of adventure serials of high quality.
The tape recordings should be returned to, or traded with, the NAEB Radio Net¬
work (NOT BBC).
Date of expiry: May 5, 1957.
